intro: Basanacantha trispinosa, commonly known as the three-spined thornvine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and thorned structures. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Basanacantha trispinosa is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in certain areas.
